result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

JA's Review of 08/17 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (08/17) ML
Extradition Forecast

[ma] Cases 21CM404 & 22CF64 called at 10:52 AM 
Defendant David Allen Inman not in court.    Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court for David Allen Inman. Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin.
ADA Witt verifies victim rights compliance. 

Atty Rumpf has no explanation for Mr. Inman's non appearance. 

The Court lifts stay on warrant, body only if not previously specified. 
recess: 10:53am
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[ae] cases 22CM151 and 21CM405 called at 8:35 AM Defendant Angela M. Smith in court.  ADA Witt appeared for State of Wisconsin. .  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court.
Atty Huebner requests that an additional status be scheduled
The Court calls co-defendants cases 21CM404 and 22CF64. Defendant David Inman not in court. Atty Rumpf in court.
Atty Rumpf is unable to provide an explanation as to why her client fails to appear.
Parties agree with scheduling an additional status for Ms Smiths cases and status/prelim for Mr Inmann's cases.
The Court issues and stays warrant until next court date for Mr. Inman's two cases.
NEXT: As to 21CM151 and 21CM405 STC 8/5/22 at 10:30 am; As to 21CM404 and 22CF64 STC and Prelim 8/5/22 at 10:30
recess: 8:41 am
Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Cases 21CM404 & 22CF64 called at 9:00 AM 
Defendant David Allen Inman appears via telephone. Attorney Amber K. Rumpf appears in court.  Michael C. Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr. Inman explains that he has had recent covid exposure. 
Atty Rumpf confirms that Mr. Inman contacted her yesterday to explain his circumstances, she instructed him to call in. 
ADA Witt indicates that a witness is not present, as State was aware of Mr. Inman's likely telephone appearance. 

recess: 9:04am 
NEXT: Status(21CM404)/Preliminary Hearing(22CF64) on 7/21/22 at 8:30am

Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Cases 21CM404 & 22CF64 called at 2:06pm 
Defendant David Allen Inman in court with Attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Rumpf gives explanation for Mr. Inman's prior missed court appearance. 

Bond Arguments given by Counsel. 

The Court reinstates the signature bond in Case 21CM404
The Court requires a $100 CASH bond in Case 22CF64, with same non-monetary conditions.

The Court quashes warrants 
recess: 2:10pm 
NEXT: (1)Pretrial on 5/25/22 at 2:40pm (2)Preliminary Hearing/Status on 7/1/22 at 9:00am
--no acts or threats of violence
This request is approved.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Att Rumpf
Extradition Forecast

[MK] cases #21CM404 and #22CF64 called at 2:12pm 
Defendant David Allen Inman not in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Theses cases are scheduled for Status Conference today.  
In each case the Court orders issuance of a Bench Warrant-Body only, returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate.  
recess 2:13pm.
Status of Counsel
Status conference on April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

[MK] cases #21CM404, #21CM405 and #22CF64 called at 1:43pm 
Co-Defendant David Allen Inman in court.
Co-Defendant Angelea M Smith in court.
ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court notes that Mr. Inman has been found eligible for Public Defender representation; the PD is continuing efforts to appoint counsel for him.   
As to counsel for Ms. Smith: Ms. Smith indicates that she has contacted the Public Defenders Office and is awaiting a response. The Court directs Ms. Smith to continue those efforts with the PD, but she is also required to go to Clerk of Courts Office after this hearing to complete and file a petition for the appointment of counsel so that the clerk has that petition-form available to process if it is learned that she does not qualify for PD representation. 
The Court schedules another status conference, indicating that time limits are tolled.
Mr. Inman verifies that the 225 S Water Street E #111 address is current.
Ms. Smith verifies that the W6604 County Road J address is current.
recess 1:48pm 

NEXT : Status Conference (status of counsel) on April 5th at 1:30pm [JA-note in felony case comments that the case is at prelim-stage]
Status of Counsel
Scheduling Order
Status conference on March 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

[ae] case called 11:43 AM Defendant David Allen Inman appeared by telephone. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court maintains $500 signature bond previously set

recess 11:51 am
NEXT: (1) Status Conference on 3/10/22 at 1:30 pm[Clerk is to update defendants other open criminal cases to the Fort Atkinson address]
Clerk Notes: David contaced clerk on 03/07/2022 requesting to appear by telephone due to current weather conditions and not having a ride. (NMS)
